description: Tender, pan-seared chicken breasts simmered in a zesty lemon-garlic butter sauce. This bright and savory dish pairs perfectly with rice, pasta, or roasted vegetables for an easy weeknight meal.
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Marinate chicken with olive oil, garlic, lemon juice, and herbs.
Bake until golden brown and cooked through.
Mix marinade ingredients.
Coat chicken evenly.
Bake for 25 minutes.
additionalNotes: Great with roasted vegetables or couscous.

description: Silky pasta coated in a rich, garlicky cream sauce loaded with sautéed mushrooms and Parmesan. It’s an earthy, comforting dish that comes together quickly but tastes restaurant-quality.
instructions: Cook pasta until al dente.
Sauté mushrooms in butter and garlic.
Add cream, cheese, and toss with pasta.
Boil pasta.
Cook mushrooms.
Combine with cream sauce.
additionalNotes: Use fettuccine or tagliatelle for best texture.

description: Crispy tofu cubes tossed with colorful vegetables in a bold, chili-garlic sauce. This quick, high-protein meal brings a satisfying kick and can be served over rice or noodles.
instructions: Press tofu to remove excess moisture.
Sauté vegetables and tofu in sesame oil.
Add spicy sauce and toss to coat.
Prep tofu and veggies.
Stir-fry in hot wok.
Add sauce and finish with sesame seeds.
additionalNotes: Serve over jasmine rice for a full meal.

description: Tender beef slices and crisp broccoli florets cooked in a savory soy-garlic glaze. It’s a classic takeout favorite that’s simple to make at home in under 30 minutes.
instructions: Slice beef thinly and marinate in soy sauce mixture.
Stir-fry beef until browned.
Add broccoli and sauce, cook until tender.
Prep beef and marinade.
Cook beef quickly over high heat.
Add broccoli and finish with sauce.
additionalNotes: Add chili flakes for a spicy kick.

description: Fluffy, hearty pancakes made with oats and bursting with fresh blueberries. These wholesome breakfast treats are naturally sweet, fiber-packed, and perfect with a drizzle of maple syrup.
instructions: Mix oats, flour, and baking powder in a bowl.
Whisk in milk, egg, and vanilla.
Fold in blueberries and cook on griddle.
Make batter.
Add blueberries.
Cook until golden on both sides.
additionalNotes: Top with maple syrup or yogurt for extra flavor.
